- [PayPal Direct App Switch integration](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/features/app-switch.md)

- [Fastlane integration](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/methods/cards/fastlane.md)

- [Payment Links and Buttons API](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/methods/pay-links-buttons-api.md)
- [Integrate PayPal directly with the Orders v2 API](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/methods/paypal/api/one-time/orders-api-integration.md)
- [Integrate PayPal Checkout with PayPal's JavaScript SDK v6](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/methods/paypal/sdk/js/v6/paypal-checkout.md)
- [Integrate Venmo with PayPal's JavaScript SDK v6](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/methods/venmo/integrate.md)
- [Save payment methods directly with the Payment Method Tokens API](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/save/api/vault-api-integration.md)
- [Test saving cards with a direct Payment Method Tokens API integration](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/save/api/vault-api-integration-test.md)
- [Save cards with purchase with the JavaScript SDK](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/save/sdk/cards/js-sdk-v6-vault.md)
- [Save cards without purchase with the JavaScript SDK](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/save/sdk/cards/js-sdk-v6-vault-no-purchase.md)
- [Save PayPal without purchase with the JavaScript SDK](https://docs.paypal.ai/payments/save/sdk/paypal/js-sdk-v6-vault.md)
- [Create subscription alert](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/alerts/create-subscription-alert.md): Establishes a new usage-based alert for a subscription to notify merchants when consumption reaches specified thresholds. Supports multiple alert types including current billing period usage, lifetime usage, and metric-specific monitoring for both monetary amounts and consumption units.
- [Modify subscription alert](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/alerts/modify-subscription-alert.md): Updates the configuration of an existing subscription alert.
- [Remove subscription alert](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/alerts/remove-subscription-alert.md): Permanently deletes a subscription alert identified by its unique code. This operation cannot be undone and will immediately stop all monitoring associated with this alert configuration.
- [Retrieve specific subscription alert](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/alerts/retrieve-specific-subscription-alert.md): Retrieves detailed information about a specific alert identified by its unique code within a subscription.
- [Retrieve subscription alerts](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/alerts/retrieve-subscription-alerts.md): Retrieves all usage-based alerts configured for a specific subscription. Use this endpoint to monitor and manage billing alerts across different consumption thresholds.
- [Capture authorized payment](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/authorizations/capture-authorized-payment.md): Captures an authorized payment, by ID.
- [Reauthorize authorized payment](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/authorizations/reauthorize-authorized-payment.md): Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. Within the 29-day authorization period, you can issue multiple re-authorizations after the honor period expires.<br/><br/>If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.<br/><br/>A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.<br/><br/>You can reauthorize an authorized payment from 4 to 29 days after the 3-day honor period. The allowed amount depends on context and geography, for example in US it is up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.<br/><br/>Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
- [Show details for authorized payment](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/authorizations/show-details-for-authorized-payment.md): Shows details for an authorized payment, by ID.
- [Void authorized payment](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/authorizations/void-authorized-payment.md): Voids, or cancels, an authorized payment, by ID. You cannot void an authorized payment that has been fully captured.
- [List all balances](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/balances/list-all-balances.md): List all balances. Specify date time to list balances for that time that appear in the response.<blockquote><strong>Notes:</strong> <ul><li>It takes a maximum of three hours for balances to appear in the list balances call.</li><li>This call lists balances upto the previous three years.</li></ul></blockquote>
- [Create a billing entity](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/billing-entities/create-a-billing-entity.md)
- [Get a billing entity by code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/billing-entities/get-a-billing-entity-by-code.md)
- [List all billing entities](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/billing-entities/list-all-billing-entities.md)
- [Update a billing entity by code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/billing-entities/update-a-billing-entity-by-code.md)
- [Refund captured payment](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/captures/refund-captured-payment.md): Refunds a captured payment, by ID. For a full refund, include an empty payload in the JSON request body. For a partial refund, include an <code>amount</code> object in the JSON request body.
- [Show captured payment details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/captures/show-captured-payment-details.md): Shows details for a captured payment, by ID.
- [Create cart](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/cart-operations/create-cart.md): Creates a new cart with the provided PayPalCart object. This is called by PayPal Shopping Cart
when an AI agent or customer initiates a checkout process.

**Returns:**
- `201 Created`: Cart created successfully with payment token in payment_method
- `200 OK` + `validation_issues`: Business logic issues that need resolution
- `400 Bad Request`: Invalid request format
- `422 Unprocessable Entity`: Validation errors in cart data
- `500 Internal Server Error`: System errors

- [Get cart details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/cart-operations/get-cart-details.md): Retrieves the current state of a cart. Used by PayPal Shopping Cart to check
cart status, validation issues, and current totals.

**Error Handling:**
- **400 Bad Request**: Cart ID format is invalid (e.g., doesn't match expected pattern)
- **404 Not Found**: Cart ID is well-formed but doesn't exist in merchant's system
- **500 Internal Server Error**: System error during cart retrieval

- [Update cart](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/cart-operations/update-cart.md): Updates a cart by completely replacing its contents with the provided PayPalCart object.
This is used when customers make changes like adding items, updating shipping address,
applying coupons, or completing checkout fields.

**⚠️ CRITICAL: Complete Replacement Operation**
- PUT replaces the ENTIRE cart with the provided PayPalCart object
- Any fields not included in the request will be removed/reset
- Missing fields will be lost (e.g., omitting customer info will remove it)

- [Complete checkout](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/checkout/complete-checkout.md): Completes the checkout process after customer has approved payment via PayPal.
This endpoint receives the payment method with payer_id and finalizes the order.

**Called when:** Customer completes PayPal payment approval
**Required:** payment_method with valid token and payer_id

- [List Connections.](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/connections/list-connections.md): Lists connections to accounting platforms per merchant.
- [Create a new credit note](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/credit-notes/create-a-new-credit-note.md)
- [Get a single credit note by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/credit-notes/get-a-single-credit-note-by-id.md)
- [Get all credit notes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/credit-notes/get-all-credit-notes.md)
- [Void a credit note](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/credit-notes/void-a-credit-note.md): Voids a credit note, making it no longer available for use. This action cannot be undone.
- [Create a new customer](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/create-a-new-customer.md)
- [Delete a customer by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/delete-a-customer-by-id.md)
- [Get a customer by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/get-a-customer-by-id.md)
- [Get all customers](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/get-all-customers.md)
- [Get an embeddable URL to the customer portal](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/get-an-embeddable-url-to-the-customer-portal.md)
- [Get current usage for a customer](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/get-current-usage-for-a-customer.md): Retrieves the current billing period usage information for a specific customer
- [Get past usage for a customer](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/get-past-usage-for-a-customer.md): Retrieves historical usage information for a specific customer across previous billing periods
- [Retrieve customer analytics for overdue balance](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/retrieve-customer-analytics-for-overdue-balance.md)
- [Retrieve customer gross revenue analytics](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/retrieve-customer-gross-revenue-analytics.md)
- [Update a customer by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/customers/update-a-customer-by-id.md)
- [Accept claim](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/accept-claim.md): Accepts liability for a claim, by ID. When you accept liability for a claim, the dispute closes in the customer’s favor and PayPal automatically refunds money to the customer from the merchant's account. Allowed accept_claim_type values for the request is available in dispute details <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#definition-allowed_response_options">allowed response options</a> object.
- [Accept offer to resolve dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/accept-offer-to-resolve-dispute.md): The customer accepts the offer from merchant to resolve a dispute, by ID. PayPal automatically refunds the amount proposed by merchant to the customer.
- [Acknowledge returned item](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/acknowledge-returned-item.md): Acknowledges that the customer returned an item for a dispute, by ID. A merchant can make this request for disputes with the `MERCHANDISE_OR_SERVICE_NOT_AS_DESCRIBED` reason. Allowed acknowledgement_type values for the request is available in dispute details <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#definition-allowed_response_options">allowed response options</a> object. For constraints and rules regarding documents, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#documents">documents</a>.
- [Appeal dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/appeal-dispute.md): Appeals a dispute, by ID. To appeal a dispute, use the <code>appeal</code> link in the <a href="/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links/">HATEOAS links</a> from the show dispute details response. If this link does not appear, you cannot appeal the dispute. Submit new evidence as a document or notes in the JSON request body. For constraints and rules regarding documents, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#documents">documents</a>.<br/>To make this request, specify the dispute ID in the URI and specify the evidence in the JSON request body. For information about dispute reasons, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#dispute-reasons">dispute reasons</a>.
- [Deny offer to resolve dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/deny-offer-to-resolve-dispute.md): Denies an offer that the merchant proposes for a dispute, by ID.
- [Escalate dispute to claim](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/escalate-dispute-to-claim.md): Escalates the dispute, by ID, to a PayPal claim. To make this call, the stage in the dispute lifecycle must be `INQUIRY`.
- [Make offer to resolve dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/make-offer-to-resolve-dispute.md): Makes an offer to the other party to resolve a dispute, by ID. To make this call, the stage in the dispute lifecycle must be `INQUIRY`. If the customer accepts the offer, PayPal automatically makes a refund. Allowed offer_type values for the request is available in dispute details <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#definition-allowed_response_options">allowed response options</a> object.
- [Provide evidence](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/provide-evidence.md): Provides evidence for a dispute, by ID. A merchant can provide evidence for disputes with the <code>WAITING_FOR_SELLER_RESPONSE</code> status while customers can provide evidence for disputes with the <code>WAITING_FOR_BUYER_RESPONSE</code> status. Evidence can be a proof of delivery or proof of refund document or notes, which can include logs. A proof of delivery document includes a tracking number while a proof of refund document includes a refund ID. For other evidence type, notes and documents can be given. Evidences requested from you can be found by checking the type of evidence for the corresponding source under the evidence section of the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get">show dispute details</a> response. The source will be <code>REQUESTED_FROM_SELLER</code> for evidences requested from the merchant while it will be <code>REQUESTED_FROM_BUYER</code> for evidences requested from the customer. For constraints and rules regarding documents, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#documents">documents</a>.<br/>To make this request, specify the evidence in the JSON request body and use the <code>provide-evidence</code> link in the <a href="/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links/">HATEOAS links</a> of the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get">show dispute details</a> response. In case the link is not present in the response, you can't provide evidence for the dispute. For information about dispute reasons, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#dispute-reasons">dispute reasons</a>.
- [Provide supporting information for dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/provide-supporting-information-for-dispute.md): Provides supporting information for a dispute, by ID. A merchant or buyer can make this request for disputes if they find the `provide-supporting-info` link in the HATEOAS links in the list disputes response. The party can provide the supporting information to PayPal to defend themselves only when the `dispute_life_cycle_stage` is `CHARGEBACK`, `PRE_ARBITRATION`, or `ARBITRATION`. They can provide a note that describes their part with details or upload any supporting documents to support their side. For constraints and rules regarding documents, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#documents">documents</a>.<br/>To make this request, specify the dispute ID in the URI and specify the notes in the JSON request body. This method differs from the provide evidence method which supports only multipart request, where PayPal asks the concerned party for evidence.
- [Send message about dispute to other party](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/send-message-about-dispute-to-other-party.md): Sends a message about a dispute, by ID, to the other party in the dispute. Merchants and customers can only send messages if the `dispute_life_cycle_stage` value is `INQUIRY`. For constraints and rules regarding documents that can be attached as part of the message, see <a href="/docs/integration/direct/customer-disputes/integration-guide/#documents">documents</a>. To send a message, use the <code>send-message</code> link in the <a href="/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links/">HATEOAS links</a> of the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get">show dispute details</a> response and specify the message in the JSON request body. In case the link is not present in the response you can't send a message on the dispute.
- [Settle dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/settle-dispute.md): <blockquote><strong>Important:</strong> This method is for sandbox use only.</blockquote> Settles a dispute in either the customer's or merchant's favor. Merchants can make this call in the sandbox to complete end-to-end dispute resolution testing, which mimics the dispute resolution that PayPal agents normally complete. To make this call, the dispute <code>status</code> must be <code>UNDER_REVIEW</code> and <code>adjudicate</code> link  should be available in the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get!c=200&path=links&t=response/">HATEOAS links</a> of the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get">show dispute details</a> response.
- [Update dispute status](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes-actions/update-dispute-status.md): <blockquote><strong>Important:</strong> This method is for sandbox use only.</blockquote> Updates the status of a dispute, by ID, from <code>UNDER_REVIEW</code> to either:<ul><li><code>WAITING_FOR_BUYER_RESPONSE</code></li><li><code>WAITING_FOR_SELLER_RESPONSE</code></li></ul>This status change enables either the customer or merchant to submit evidence for the dispute. To make this call, the dispute <code>status</code> must be <code>UNDER_REVIEW</code> and <code>require-evidence</code> link  should be available in the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get!c=200&path=links&t=response/">HATEOAS links</a> of the <a href="/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get">show dispute details</a> response. Specify an <code>action</code> value in the JSON request body to indicate whether the status change enables the customer or merchant to submit evidence:<table><thead><tr align="left"><th>If <code>action</code> is</th><th>The <code>status</code> updates to</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>BUYER_EVIDENCE</code></td><td> <code>WAITING_FOR_BUYER_RESPONSE</code></td></tr><tr><td><code>SELLER_EVIDENCE</code></td><td> <code>WAITING_FOR_SELLER_RESPONSE</code></td></tr></tbody></table>.
- [List disputes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes/list-disputes.md): Lists disputes with a summary set of details, which shows the <code>dispute_id</code>, <code>reason</code>, <code>status</code>, <code>dispute_state</code>, <code>dispute_life_cycle_stage</code>, <code>dispute_channel</code>, <code>dispute_amount</code>, <code>create_time</code> and <code>update_time</code> fields.<br/><br/>To filter the disputes in the response, specify one or more optional query parameters. To limit the number of disputes in the response, specify the <code>page_size</code> query parameter.<br/><br/>To list multiple disputes, set these query parameters in the request:<ul><li><code>page_size=2</code></li><li><code>start_time</code> instead of <code>disputed_transaction_id</code></li></ul><br/>If the response contains more than two disputes, it lists two disputes and includes a HATEOAS link to the next page of results.
- [Partially update dispute](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes/partially-update-dispute.md): Partially updates a dispute, by ID. Seller can update the `communication_detail` value or The partner can add the `partner action` information.
- [Show dispute details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/disputes/show-dispute-details.md): Shows details for a dispute, by ID.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> The fields that appear in the response depend on the access. For example, if the merchant requests shows dispute details, the customer's email ID does not appear.</blockquote>
- [Create an entitlement](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/create-an-entitlement.md): Assign a feature to a plan with specific privilege values. This action removes all current entitlements and replaces with the new ones provided. To retain existing entitlements while adding new ones, apply a PATCH request.
- [Delete an entitlement](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/delete-an-entitlement.md): Remove a feature entitlement from a plan
- [List all entitlements](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/list-all-entitlements.md): Retrieve all entitlements assigned to a specific plan
- [List all subscription entitlements](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/list-all-subscription-entitlements.md): Retrieve effective entitlements for a subscription, including plan defaults and subscription-specific overrides
- [Partial update of entitlements](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/partial-update-of-entitlements.md): Update privilege values for one or more plan entitlements. Any new privileges or features you provide will be added. Existing values are overwritten if duplicates are found. Items not included in the request will be left unchanged.
- [Remove a privilege from a subscription entitlement override](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/remove-a-privilege-from-a-subscription-entitlement-override.md): Remove a specific privilege override from a subscription entitlement, reverting to plan default for that privilege
- [Remove a privilege from an entitlement](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/remove-a-privilege-from-an-entitlement.md): Remove a specific privilege from a plan entitlement
- [Remove an entitlement from a subscription](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/remove-an-entitlement-from-a-subscription.md): Remove a subscription-specific entitlement override, reverting to plan defaults
- [Retrieve an entitlement](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/retrieve-an-entitlement.md): Get details of a specific entitlement for a plan
- [Update subscription entitlements](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/entitlements/update-subscription-entitlements.md): This endpoint performs partial updates to subscription entitlements. The entitlements in the request are combined with existing entitlements associated with the subscription (even the ones inherited from plan) that are not mentioned in the request.
- [Create a new usage event](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/events/create-a-new-usage-event.md)
- [Create multiple usage events in batch.](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/events/create-multiple-usage-events-in-batch.md)
- [Query usage events](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/events/query-usage-events.md)
- [Receive updated order information via callback URL](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/externalcallback/receive-updated-order-information-via-callback-url.md): The documentation for this 'endpoint' is different from the other endpoints under v2 Orders. For this endpoint the role of client and server is reversed. The client sending the request is PayPal, and the server sending the response is the merchant. In the request, PayPal will send the buyer's redacted shipping address and selected shipping option to the callback URL defined the create order request. The response from the merchant will update the Orders resource.
- [Create a feature](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/features/create-a-feature.md): Creates a new feature that represents a capability or functionality that can be entitled to customers. Features are the building blocks of your entitlement system - they define what can be granted to customers and what aspects can be configured. Each feature can have multiple privileges that allow fine-grained control over its behavior (e.g., a 'seats' feature might have 'max' and 'max_admins' privileges). Once created, features can be assigned to plans with specific privilege values.
- [Delete a feature](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/features/delete-a-feature.md): Permanently deletes a feature from the system. This is a destructive operation that will remove the feature and all its associated entitlements from every plan and subscription. Use with caution as this cannot be undone. The operation will fail if the feature is currently assigned to any active plans or subscriptions to prevent accidental data loss.
- [Delete a feature privilege](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/features/delete-a-feature-privilege.md): Removes a specific privilege from a feature definition. This is a destructive operation that affects all plans and subscriptions using this feature - the privilege and any values assigned to it will be permanently removed from all entitlements. Use this when a privilege is no longer needed or was created in error.
- [List all features](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/features/list-all-features.md): Retrieves a comprehensive list of all features defined in your system. Features represent capabilities or functionalities that can be entitled to customers through subscription plans. Use this endpoint to discover available features when building plan configurations or displaying feature catalogs to administrators.
- [Retrieve a feature](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/features/retrieve-a-feature.md): Retrieves complete details of a specific feature including all its privileges and configuration. Use this endpoint to inspect feature capabilities before creating entitlements or to display feature details in administrative interfaces.
- [Update a feature](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/features/update-a-feature.md): Updates an existing feature's properties including name, description, and privileges. The feature code itself cannot be changed. When updating privileges, the entire privileges array is replaced - to add or remove individual privileges, you must provide the complete desired list. Changes to features automatically propagate to all plans and subscriptions using them, though assigned values remain unchanged.
- [List Connection Status for an Invoice.](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoice-connection-details/list-connection-status-for-an-invoice.md): Lists connections to accounting platforms per invoice.
- [Cancel sent invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/cancel-sent-invoice.md): Cancels a sent invoice, by ID, and, optionally, sends a notification about the cancellation to the payer, merchant, and CC: emails.
- [Create draft invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/create-draft-invoice.md): Creates a draft invoice. To move the invoice from a draft to payable state, you must <a href="#invoices_send">send the invoice</a>.<br/><br/>In the JSON request body, include invoice details including merchant information. The <code>invoice</code> object must include an <code>items</code> array.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> The merchant that you specify in an invoice must have a PayPal account in good standing.</blockquote>.
- [Delete external payment](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/delete-external-payment.md): Deletes an external payment, by invoice ID and transaction ID.
- [Delete external refund](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/delete-external-refund.md): Deletes an external refund, by invoice ID and transaction ID.
- [Delete invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/delete-invoice.md): Deletes a draft or scheduled invoice, by ID. Deletes invoices in the draft or scheduled state only. For invoices that have already been sent, you can <a href="/docs/api/invoicing/v2/#invoices_cancel">cancel the invoice</a>. After you delete a draft or scheduled invoice, you can no longer use it or show its details. However, you can reuse its invoice number.
- [Fully update invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/fully-update-invoice.md): Fully updates an invoice, by ID. In the JSON request body, include a complete `invoice` object. This call does not support partial updates. <blockquote><strong>Notes:</strong><ul><li>API caller can change/modify recipient only 2 times in 72 hours.</li></ul></blockquote>.
- [Generate invoice number](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/generate-invoice-number.md): Generates the next invoice number that is available to the merchant. The next invoice number uses the prefix and suffix from the last invoice number and increments the number by one. For example, the next invoice number after `INVOICE-1234` is `INVOICE-1235`.
- [Generate QR code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/generate-qr-code.md): Generates a QR code for an invoice, by ID. The QR code is a PNG image in <a href="https://www.base64encode.org/">Base64-encoded</a> format that corresponds to the invoice ID. You can generate a QR code for an invoice and add it to a paper or PDF invoice. When customers use their mobile devices to scan the QR code, they are redirected to the PayPal mobile payment flow where they can view the invoice and pay online with PayPal or a credit card. Before you get a QR code, you must <a href="#invoices_create">create an invoice</a> and <a href="#invoices_send">send an invoice</a> to move the invoice from a draft to payable state. Do not include an email address if you do not want the invoice emailed.
- [Get a single invoice by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/get-a-single-invoice-by-id.md)
- [Get all invoices](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/get-all-invoices.md)
- [List invoices](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/list-invoices.md): Lists invoices. To filter the invoices that appear in the response, you can specify one or more optional query parameters.
- [Record payment for invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/record-payment-for-invoice.md): Records a payment for the invoice. If no payment is due, the invoice is marked as `PAID`. Otherwise, the invoice is marked as `PARTIALLY PAID`.
- [Record refund for invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/record-refund-for-invoice.md): Records a refund for the invoice. If all payments are refunded, the invoice is marked as `REFUNDED`. Otherwise, the invoice is marked as `PARTIALLY REFUNDED`.
- [Retry payment for a specific invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/retry-payment-for-a-specific-invoice.md)
- [Send invoice](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/send-invoice.md): Sends or schedules an invoice, by ID, to be sent to a customer. The action depends on the invoice issue date:<ul><li>If the invoice issue date is current or in the past, sends the invoice immediately.</li><li>If the invoice issue date is in the future, schedules the invoice to be sent on that date.</li></ul>To suppress the merchant's email notification, set the `send_to_invoicer` body parameter to `false`. To send the invoice through a share link and not through PayPal, set the <code>send_to_recipient</code> parameter to <code>false</code> in the <code>notification</code> object. The <code>send_to_recipient</code> parameter does not apply to a future issue date because the invoice is scheduled to be sent through PayPal on that date.<blockquote><strong>Notes:</strong><ul><li>After you send an invoice, resending it has no effect.</li><li>To send a notification for updates, <a href="#invoices_update">update the invoice</a> and set the <code>send_to_recipient</code> body parameter to <code>true</code>.</li></ul></blockquote>
- [Send invoice reminder](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/send-invoice-reminder.md): Sends a reminder to the payer about an invoice, by ID. In the JSON request body, include a `notification` object that defines the subject of the reminder and other details. <blockquote><strong>Notes:</strong><ul><li>API caller can send only 2 reminders in a day.</li></ul></blockquote>.
- [Show invoice details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/invoices/show-invoice-details.md): Shows details for an invoice, by ID.
- [Activate Usage Based Billing](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/merchant-activation/activate-usage-based-billing.md)
- [Create a new metric](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/metrics/create-a-new-metric.md)
- [Delete a metric by Code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/metrics/delete-a-metric-by-code.md)
- [Get a metric by code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/metrics/get-a-metric-by-code.md)
- [Get all metrics](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/metrics/get-all-metrics.md)
- [Update a metric by Code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/metrics/update-a-metric-by-code.md)
- [Add tracking information for an Order.](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/add-tracking-information-for-an-order.md): Adds tracking information for an Order.
- [Authorize payment for order](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/authorize-payment-for-order.md): Authorizes payment for an order. To successfully authorize payment for an order, the buyer must first approve the order or a valid payment_source must be provided in the request. A buyer can approve the order upon being redirected to the rel:approve URL that was returned in the HATEOAS links in the create order response.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> For error handling and troubleshooting, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/reference/orders/v2/errors/#authorize-order">Orders v2 errors</a>.</blockquote>
- [Capture payment for order](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/capture-payment-for-order.md): Captures payment for an order. To successfully capture payment for an order, the buyer must first approve the order or a valid payment_source must be provided in the request. A buyer can approve the order upon being redirected to the rel:approve URL that was returned in the HATEOAS links in the create order response.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> For error handling and troubleshooting, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/reference/orders/v2/errors/#capture-order">Orders v2 errors</a>.</blockquote>
- [Confirm the Order](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/confirm-the-order.md): Payer confirms their intent to pay for the the Order with the given payment source.
- [Create order](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/create-order.md): Creates an order. Merchants and partners can add Level 2 and 3 data to payments to reduce risk and payment processing costs. For more information about processing payments, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/checkout/advanced/processing/">checkout</a> or <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/multiparty/checkout/advanced/processing/">multiparty checkout</a>.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> For error handling and troubleshooting, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/reference/orders/v2/errors/#create-order">Orders v2 errors</a>.</blockquote>
- [Show order details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/show-order-details.md): Shows details for an order, by ID.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> For error handling and troubleshooting, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/reference/orders/v2/errors/#get-order">Orders v2 errors</a>.</blockquote>
- [Update order](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/orders/update-order.md): Updates an order with a `CREATED` or `APPROVED` status. You cannot update an order with the `COMPLETED` status.<br/><br/>To make an update, you must provide a `reference_id`. If you omit this value with an order that contains only one purchase unit, PayPal sets the value to `default` which enables you to use the path: <code>\"/purchase_units/@reference_id=='default'/{attribute-or-object}\"</code>. Merchants and partners can add Level 2 and 3 data to payments to reduce risk and payment processing costs. For more information about processing payments, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/checkout/advanced/processing/">checkout</a> or <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/multiparty/checkout/advanced/processing/">multiparty checkout</a>.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> For error handling and troubleshooting, see <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/reference/orders/v2/errors/#patch-order">Orders v2 errors</a>.</blockquote>Patchable attributes or objects:<br/><br/><table><thead><th>Attribute</th><th>Op</th><th>Notes</th></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>intent</code></td><td>replace</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>payer</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td>Using replace op for <code>payer</code> will replace the whole <code>payer</code> object with the value sent in request.</td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].custom_id</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].description</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].payee.email</code></td><td>replace</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].shipping.name</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].shipping.email_address</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].shipping.phone_number</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].shipping.options</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].shipping.address</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].shipping.type</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].soft_descriptor</code></td><td>replace, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].amount</code></td><td>replace</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].items</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].invoice_id</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].payment_instruction</code></td><td>replace</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].payment_instruction.disbursement_mode</code></td><td>replace</td><td>By default, <code>disbursement_mode</code> is <code>INSTANT</code>.</td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].payment_instruction.payee_receivable_fx_rate_id</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].payment_instruction.platform_fees</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].supplementary_data.airline</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>purchase_units[].supplementary_data.card</code></td><td>replace, add, remove</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>application_context.client_configuration</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
- [Creates a payment resource for a single-item purchase](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-resources/creates-a-payment-resource-for-a-single-item-purchase.md): Creates a new PayPal payment resource for a single-item Buy Now checkout. Returns the full resource details including ID, payment link url, and status.
- [Delete a payment resource](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-resources/delete-a-payment-resource.md): Permanently deletes the specified payment resource. Operation is irreversible and returns HTTP 204 No Content.
- [List payment resources](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-resources/list-payment-resources.md): Returns a paginated list of payment resources created by the authenticated merchant. Supports filtering by status and pagination parameters.
- [Replace a payment resource](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-resources/replace-a-payment-resource.md): Replaces all editable fields of an existing payment resource. Use this for full updates.
- [Retrieve a payment resource](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-resources/retrieve-a-payment-resource.md): Retrieves details for a specific payment resource, including current status, integration configuration, and related HATEOAS links.
- [Create payment token for a given payment source](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-tokens/create-payment-token-for-a-given-payment-source.md): Creates a Payment Token from the given payment source and adds it to the Vault of the associated customer.
- [Delete payment token](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-tokens/delete-payment-token.md): Delete the payment token associated with the payment token id.
- [List all payment tokens](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-tokens/list-all-payment-tokens.md): Returns all payment tokens for a customer.
- [Retrieve a payment token](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payment-tokens/retrieve-a-payment-token.md): Returns a readable representation of vaulted payment source associated with the payment token id.
- [Cancel unclaimed payout item](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payouts-item/cancel-unclaimed-payout-item.md): Cancels an unclaimed payout item, by ID. If no one claims the unclaimed item within 30 days, the API automatically returns the funds to the sender. Use this call to cancel the unclaimed item before the automatic 30-day refund. You can cancel payout items with a <code>transaction_status</code> of <code>UNCLAIMED</code>.
- [Show payout item details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payouts-item/show-payout-item-details.md): Shows details for a payout item, by ID. A <code>payout_item_id</code> helps you identify denied payments. If a payment is denied, you can use the <code>payout_item_id</code> to identify the payment even if it lacks a <code>transaction_id</code>.
- [Create batch payout](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payouts/create-batch-payout.md): Creates a batch payout. In the JSON request body, pass a `sender_batch_header` and an `items` array. The `sender_batch_header` defines how to handle the payout. The `items` array defines the payout items.<br/>You can make payouts to one or more recipients.<blockquote><strong>Notes:</strong> <ul><li><p>PayPal does not process duplicate payouts. If you specify a <code>sender_batch_id</code> that was used in the last 30 days, the API rejects the request with an error message that shows the duplicate <code>sender_batch_id</code> and includes a HATEOAS link to the original payout with the same <code>sender_batch_id</code>.</p><p>If you receive an HTTP <code>5<i>nn</i></code> status code, you can safely retry the request with the same <code>sender_batch_id</code>.</p></li><li><p>The Payouts API does not support build notation (BN) codes. In a future Payouts release, you can optionally provide BN codes in the <code>PayPal-Partner-Attribution-Id</code> request header.</p><p>For information about the <code>PayPal-Partner-Attribution-Id</code> header, see <a href="/api/rest/requests/#http-request-headers">HTTP request headers</a>. To learn about or request a BN code, contact your partner manager or see <a href="https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/partner-program">PayPal Partner Program</a>.</p></li></ul></blockquote>
- [Show payout batch details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/payouts/show-payout-batch-details.md): Shows the latest status of a batch payout. Includes the transaction status and other data for individual payout items.
- [Create a new plan](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/plans/create-a-new-plan.md)
- [Delete a plan by Code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/plans/delete-a-plan-by-code.md): Delete a plan by providing the plan ID. This operation permanently removes the plan from the system.
- [Get a plan by Code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/plans/get-a-plan-by-code.md)
- [Get all plans](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/plans/get-all-plans.md)
- [Update a plan by Code](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/plans/update-a-plan-by-code.md)
- [Create Exchange Rate Quote](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/quote-exchange-rates/create-exchange-rate-quote.md): <strong>Purpose:</strong><ul><p>The PayPal Exchange Rate Quote API enables businesses to dynamically display prices in multiple currencies by generating exchange rate quotes for currency pair.</p></ul><strong>Key Features:</strong><ul><p>FX Rate Guarantee: Guarantees exchange rates for a specified duration, ensuring stability and consistency in currency presentment scenarios.</p><p>Customizable Pricing: Provides flexible exchange rate options tailored to business needs, allowing customization through negotiated rates and dynamic pricing models to align with business requirements.</p><p>Provides functionality to source wholesale market rates with the addition of a percentage-based currency conversion fee. This enables the delivery of retail exchange rates without offering a rate guarantee.</p><p>FX Rate Revenue Markup: Offers merchants the flexibility to apply customized markups on exchange rates, allowing them to generate additional revenue from currency conversions. Enables businesses to define their own pricing strategies by setting adjustable markups based on transaction volume, customer segments, or market conditions, ensuring greater control over foreign exchange earnings while maintaining competitive pricing for end users.</p></ul><strong>Quote API Usage:</strong><ul><p>Need a Guaranteed Rate for a Certain Timeframe: Businesses want to lock in an exchange rate for a defined period to protect against market fluctuations and reduce the risk of FX volatility.</p><p>Offer Customers Stable, Upfront Pricing for a Limited Time: Displaying FX rates but ensuring the rate remains fixed for a short duration, allowing customers to complete their purchase without unexpected price changes.</p><p>Integrate with PayPal as Payment Processor for Real-Time Quoting Scenarios: Leveraging PayPal’s payment processing capabilities, ensuring seamless multi-currency support.</p></ul><strong>Sample Use cases:</strong> Multi-Currency Presentment, Real-Time Checkout Quotes, Subscription Pricing with Guaranteed Rate, Buy-Now-Price Guarantee for Cross-Border Seller.
- [Show refund details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/refunds/show-refund-details.md): Shows details for a refund, by ID.
- [Search for invoices](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/search-invoices/search-for-invoices.md): Searches for and lists invoices that match search criteria. If you pass multiple criteria, the response lists invoices that match all criteria.
- [Create a setup token](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/setup-tokens/create-a-setup-token.md): Creates a Setup Token from the given payment source and adds it to the Vault of the associated customer.
- [Retrieve a setup token](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/setup-tokens/retrieve-a-setup-token.md): Returns a readable representation of temporarily vaulted payment source associated with the setup token id.
- [Simulate webhook event](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/simulate-event/simulate-webhook-event.md): Simulates a webhook event. In the JSON request body, specify a sample payload.<br>You need to subscribe to the following webhook events for Pay upon Invoice:<br><table><thead><tr><th>Event</th><th>Trigger</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>PAYMENT.CAPTURE.COMPLETED</code></td><td>A payment capture completes.</td></tr><tr><td><code>PAYMENT.CAPTURE.DENIED</code></td><td>A payment capture is denied.</td></tr><tr><td><code>CHECKOUT.PAYMENT-APPROVAL.REVERSED</code></td><td>PayPal reverses a payment capture.</td></tr></tbody></table>
- [Cancel a subscription](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/subscriptions/cancel-a-subscription.md): This endpoint allows you to cancel an existing subscription. You can either cancel immediately or set it to cancel at the end of the current billing period.
- [Create a new subscription](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/subscriptions/create-a-new-subscription.md)
- [Get a subscription by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/subscriptions/get-a-subscription-by-id.md)
- [Get all subscriptions](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/subscriptions/get-all-subscriptions.md)
- [Retrieve lifetime usage for a specific subscription](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/subscriptions/retrieve-lifetime-usage-for-a-specific-subscription.md)
- [Update a subscription](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/subscriptions/update-a-subscription.md): Updates an existing subscription's details such as name, or metadata. Can also schedule a future cancellation date.
- [Create a tax](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/taxes/create-a-tax.md): Creates a new tax that can be applied to invoices
- [Delete a tax](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/taxes/delete-a-tax.md): Deletes an existing tax
- [List all taxes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/taxes/list-all-taxes.md): Retrieves a paginated list of all taxes
- [Retrieve a Tax](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/taxes/retrieve-a-tax.md): Retrieves an existing tax by its unique code
- [Update a tax](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/taxes/update-a-tax.md): Updates an existing tax
- [Create template](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/templates/create-template.md): Creates an invoice template. You can use details from this template to create an invoice. You can create up to 50 templates.<blockquote><strong>Note:</strong> Every merchant starts with three PayPal system templates that are optimized for the unit type billed. The template includes `Quantity`, `Hours`, and `Amount`.</blockquote>
- [Delete template](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/templates/delete-template.md): Deletes a template, by ID.
- [Fully update template](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/templates/fully-update-template.md): Fully updates a template, by ID. In the JSON request body, include a complete `template` object. This call does not support partial updates.
- [List templates](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/templates/list-templates.md): Lists merchant-created templates with associated details. The associated details include the emails, addresses, and phone numbers from the user's PayPal profile.<br/>The user can select which values to show in the business information section of their template.
- [Show template details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/templates/show-template-details.md): Shows details for a template, by ID.
- [Update or cancel tracking information for an order](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/trackers/update-or-cancel-tracking-information-for-an-order.md): Updates or cancels the tracking information for a PayPal order, by ID. Updatable attributes or objects:<br/><br/><table><thead><th>Attribute</th><th>Op</th><th>Notes</th></thead><tbody></tr><tr><td><code>items</code></td><td>replace</td><td>Using replace op for <code>items</code> will replace the entire <code>items</code> object with the value sent in request.</td></tr><tr><td><code>notify_payer</code></td><td>replace, add</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>status</code></td><td>replace</td><td>Only patching status to CANCELLED is currently supported.</td></tr></tbody></table>
- [List transactions](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/transactions/list-transactions.md): Lists transactions. Specify one or more query parameters to filter the transaction that appear in the response.<blockquote><strong>Notes:</strong> <ul><li>If you specify one or more optional query parameters, the <code>ending_balance</code> response field is empty.</li><li>It takes a maximum of three hours for executed transactions to appear in the list transactions call.</li><li>This call lists transaction for the previous three years.</li></ul></blockquote>
- [Verify webhook signature](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/verify-webhook-signature/verify-webhook-signature.md): Verifies a webhook signature.
- [Create a new wallet](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/create-a-new-wallet.md)
- [Create Wallet transaction](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/create-wallet-transaction.md)
- [Get all wallets](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/get-all-wallets.md)
- [Get Wallet transaction by id](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/get-wallet-transaction-by-id.md)
- [Get wallet transactions](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/get-wallet-transactions.md)
- [Retrieve a wallet by ID](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/retrieve-a-wallet-by-id.md)
- [Terminate wallet](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/terminate-wallet.md)
- [Update a wallet](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/wallets/update-a-wallet.md)
- [List available events](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-event-types/list-available-events.md): Lists available events to which any webhook can subscribe. For a list of supported events, see [Webhook event names](/docs/api/notifications/webhooks/event-names/).
- [List event notifications](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-events/list-event-notifications.md): Lists webhooks event notifications. Use query parameters to filter the response.
- [Resend event notification](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-events/resend-event-notification.md): Resends a webhook event notification, by ID. Any pending notifications are not resent.
- [Show event notification details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-events/show-event-notification-details.md): Shows details for a webhooks event notification, by ID.
- [Create webhook lookup](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-lookup/create-webhook-lookup.md): Creates a webhook lookup. A webhook lookup ties the API caller's REST API app to the subject account (or, if no subject is specified, to the API caller's account). If a webhook event is generated for an event that is tied to the account but not to a particular REST API app (for example, payments initiated with the NVP/SOAP APIs or through the user interface on PayPal.com), those webhook events will treated as if they were intended for the REST API app registered in the webhook lookup instead. Webhook events will then be delivered to any webhooks registered to that REST API app.
- [Delete webhook lookup](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-lookup/delete-webhook-lookup.md): Deletes a webhook lookup, by ID.
- [List webhook lookups](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-lookup/list-webhook-lookups.md): Lists webhook lookups.
- [Show webhook lookup details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks-lookup/show-webhook-lookup-details.md): Shows details for a webhook lookup, by ID.
- [Create webhook](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks/create-webhook.md): Subscribes your webhook listener to events.
- [Delete webhook](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks/delete-webhook.md): Deletes a webhook, by ID.
- [List event subscriptions for webhook](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks/list-event-subscriptions-for-webhook.md): Lists event subscriptions for a webhook, by ID.
- [List webhooks](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks/list-webhooks.md): Lists webhooks for an app.
- [Show webhook details](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks/show-webhook-details.md): Shows details for a webhook, by ID.
- [Update webhook](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/api/rest/webhooks/update-webhook.md): Updates a webhook to replace webhook fields with new values. Supports only the `replace` operation. Pass a `json_patch` object with `replace` operation and `path`, which is `/url` for a URL or `/event_types` for events. The `value` is either the URL or a list of events.
- [Country and region codes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/codes/country-codes.md)
- [Currency codes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/codes/currency-codes.md)
- [Locale codes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/codes/locale-codes.md)
- [State and province codes](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/codes/state-province-codes.md)
- [PayPal JavaScript SDK v6 Reference](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/sdk/js/v6/reference.md)
- [Disputes v1](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/disputes-v1.md)
- [Invoicing v2](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/invoicing-v2.md)
- [Orders V2](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/orders-v2.md)
- [Payment Method Tokens v3](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/payment-method-tokens-v3.md)
- [Payments v2](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/payments-v2.md)
- [Payouts v1](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/payouts-v1.md)
- [Webhook message format](https://docs.paypal.ai/reference/webhook-events/webhook-format.md)


## Optional

- [Server SDKs](https://developer.paypal.com/serversdk/java/getting-started/how-to-get-started)
